nodes.bodyText: Fixed here as well as in the other file.
Doesn't the user need to delete in this case? So should it be a info, or even warn?
We do not know it exists. But since we do not have access to delete it, we assume it does not exist since we did not had access to create it.
It it's a KubernetesClientException I think there should be a status code, which might be a little less fragile than contains on the message.
I do not think there is any code which is exposed. This is the logic we use for the creation as well.
OK, but I think we should factor out a method for these, both here and for the creation.

Hmm, good point. I'm not good at this programming thing ... but I excel in the copy-pasting discipline. And you know how it is ... when all you know is a Cmd-C/Cmd-V everything looks like a copy paste problem :-/. Anyway, it should be fixed now.
